AV-Surf: Surface-Enhanced Geometry-Aware Novel-View Acoustic Synthesis

Anonymous ICCV submission
Paper ID : 8846
Paper arXiv Video Code

Overview

Abstract

Accurately modeling sound propagation with complex real-world environments is essential for Novel View Acoustic Synthesis (NVAS). While previous studies have leveraged visual perception to estimate spatial acoustics, the combined use of surface and structural details from 3D representations in acoustic modeling has been underexplored. In this paper, we propose a surface-geometry aware approach for NVAS, incorporating both surface and geometric priors to improve spatial acoustic modeling. Our approach utilizes a 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS)-based framework to derive spatial features that enhance acoustic modeling. To effectively leverage this information, we introduce a Transformer-based model that employs cross-attention mechanisms to combine visual cues with 3D priors, facilitating a more comprehensive understanding of spatial geometry. Additionally, we design a novel ConvNeXt-based decoder that efficiently processes these features, refining spatial details to synthesize high-quality binaural audio. Experimental results on the RWAVS and SoundSpace datasets highlight the necessity of our approach, as it surpasses existing methods in novel view acoustic synthesis.
